results.update: At 8:15 PM, the Senate recessed subject to the call of the Chair.
S. 749 (Restore States' sovereign rights to enforce state and local sales and use tax laws). The first reading of the bill was agreed to. Further consideration of the bill was objected to.
S. Res. 100 (Commending the Univ of Louisville men's basketball team for winning the NCAA championship). Agreed to by unanimous consent.
S. Res. 99 (Sense of the Senate regarding public service during "Public Service Week"). Agreed to by unanimous consent.
Manchin amend #715 (Background checks).
Manchin amend #715 (Background checks).
Manchin amend #715 (Background checks).

Sen. Reid received unanimous consent that at 4:00 PM on Wednesday, April 17, 2013, the previously listed amendments will be voted on with a 60 yea vote threshold required for adoption. The votes will begin with the Manchin amend #715 and then follow the order listed above.

Sen. Reid called up the following amendments:

 Grassley amend # (Substitute amendment). 

 Leahy-Collins amend #713 (Trafficking). 

 Cornyn amend #719 (Concealed carry). 

 Feinstein amend #711 (Assault weapons and clip bans). 

 Burr amend #720 (Veterans and guns). 

 Lautenberg-Blumenthal amend #714 (High-capacity clip ban). 

 Barasso amend #717 (Privacy). 

 Harkin-Alexander amend # (Relative to mental health).
At 7:00 PM, the Senate reconvened and resumed a Legislative Session.
At 6:04 PM, the Senate recessed subject to the call of the Chair.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 16.
Mr. Woodall filed a report from the Committee on Rules on H. Res. 164.
Mr. Woodall moved that the House do now adjourn.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on April 17, 2013.
McConnell motion to proceed to and pass S. Res. 98 (Honoring the Late Margaret Thatcher) was agreed to.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
SPECIAL ORDER SPEECHES - The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 163 â€” "Electing a Member to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
